docs.snippet: A move into defensive stocks helped Britain's FTSE climb to a one-week high on Wednesday, shaking off broader concerns over the U.S. tech sector that rattled global equity markets. Shares in pharma firm Shire surged.

headline.print_headline: Defensives Push FTSE to One-Week High as Shire Soars
headline.main: Defensives Push FTSE to One-Week High as Shire Soars

docs.snippet: Asian shares fell on Wednesday after Wall Street was knocked hard by concerns about tighter controls on the tech industry, denting a brief global equities recovery driven by hopes that the risk of a U.S.-China trade war was easing.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Skid as US Tech Firms Face More Scrutiny
headline.main: Asian Shares Skid as US Tech Firms Face More Scrutiny

docs.snippet: A former Cambridge Analytica political consultant said the company's management misled the British public about work the firm did for a pro-Brexit group before the vote to leave the European Union, the Guardian reported on Friday.
